quoteFirst: At last they cleared the vessel, and as it was impossible, owing to the fury of the gale, to return to Deal, they made all sail for Ramsgate harbour.  Here they landed the rescued men at a
quoteLast: in the morning.  During the day the _Mary Somerville_ was taken back to Deal. No more vivid picture of the perils through which the lifeboatmen passed could be desired than that of the bruised and battered lifeboat, as she lay high and dry in the boathouse that afternoon.
title: Stories of the Lifeboat
author: Mundell, Frank
